titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Alec Brock Stevenson Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

relatedmaterial.p: For index to incoming and outgoing correspondence, contact Special Collections

list.item: correspondence, outgoing, 1930-1942; 99 letters, including 2 typed originals and 97 carbon copies (1-13, chronological)
correspondence, incoming, Alexander-Wilson; 113 letters, including 9? typed originals, 7 holograph, 11 carbon copies, and 2 mimeographed (14-28, alphabetical)

minutes, 1930-1942: Executive Committee of Vanderbilt Alumni Association (Oct. 21, 1930; Apr. 6, 1938; Apr. 19, 1938; Jan. 4, 1939; Apr. 13, 1939; May 29, 1941; July 9, 194l) and Board of Directors, Alumni Association (Sept. 25, 1931) (31-33)

printed material: Living Endowment (1940), "Are You Going to College?"(n.d.), "The Birth of an Idea," By-Laws for Branch Alumni Associations of Vanderbilt University, "Higher Towers," Kaufman Scholarship broadside, Living Endowment card, clippings (34)

special reports, 1929-193?: "The Alumni Association, its History and Purposes" (1 p.), "Plans for the Vanderbilt Alumnus" (1929) (5 p.), "An Outline of the Plan for Increasing the Membership in the Alumni Association . . (1937) (4 p.), etc. (42-44)
miscellaneous: Vanderbilt Club Constitution and By-Laws, tribute to Chancellor Kirkland (1937), speech (1938), account of Vanderbilt Alumni dinner (1938), Living Endowment committee instructions (45)
correspondence, outgoing, 1930-1939; lió items, including 2 typed originals, 107 carbon copies, and 7 telegrams (I-I6, chronological)

correspondence, incoming, Alexander-Williams; 92 items, in–cluding 4 holograph and 58 typed original letters, 17 carbon and 1 mimeograph copies, and 12 telegrams (17-31, alphabetical) agreements and contracts: agreement, Southeastern Conference and A.J. Norria Hill Company, June 4, 193&; contract, Vander–bilt University and University of Kentucky, May 22, 1933. (32)

booklets and clippings: Constitution and By-Laws, V.U. Athletic Association (1925?); 1931 football schedule; Constitution and By-Laws, Southeastern Conference, 1933} "Nashville, Tennessee" (Chamber of Commerce) (1933?); clippings from Tennessean about Vanderbilt football, Oct. 15 and Nov. 14, 1931 (33).

minutes, 1930-1933: Board of Directors, Athletic Association, Feb. 4, Mar. 3, Apr. 8, May 5, June 2, June 6, 1930; Memorandum of Meeting of Directors of Vanderbilt Athletic Association, Nov. 8, 1933 (35-36)
notices to box and season ticket holders, 1931-1934 (37-38)

reports, financial, 1926-1939: receipts and disbursements for four major sports, 1925-26; treasurer’s report, 1927; account of receipts and disbursements, 1927-28; analysis of auditor’s report . . ., June 1, 1928; analysis of auditor’s report, June 1, 1929; treasurer’s reports, 1930 and 1931; football ticket advertisements for Tennessean and Banner; report of finance committee, 1933; publicity account, 1933; treasurer’s reports, 1933, 1934, 1935, I936, 1937, I938, and 1939. (39-46)
reports, miscellaneous, 1931-1934: recommendation, 1931; report of football committee, 1933; resolution, 1934; publicity and sale of tickets, 1934 (47-48)

statements on broadcast question, 1931: paper advocating broad–cast (3 p.; n.d.); V.U.A.A. statement (not used), Nov. 4, 1931 (3 p.); V.U.A.A. etatment, signed, V.J. Alexander, M.P. O’Connor, A.B. Stevenson, Nov. 4, 1931 (4 p.); statement by A.B. Stevenson, Nov. l8, I93I (2 p.) (49)
